instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to determine the chemical composition of pulp wood?
Output: In this study, near infrared (NIR) spectroscopy was used to determine the chemical composition of pulp wood.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to determine the chemical composition of pulp wood?
Output: Various preprocessing techniques were used to eliminate irrelevant information from the pulp wood spectrum before establishing models using partial least squares (PLS) regression, back propagating neural network (BPNN), least square support vector machine (LSSVM), and kernel extreme learning machine (KELM).

instruction: What metric was chosen to determine the chemical composition of pulp wood, and how far can this metric go ?
Output: The metric chosen to determine the chemical composition of pulp wood was the contents of lignin and holocellulose. This metric can provide accurate and reliable values for the lignin and holocellulose contents of five common pulp wood species.

instruction: What machine learning models were used to compare the modeling approaches in accurately and efficiently determining the chemical composition of pulp wood using NIR spectroscopy?
Output: The machine learning models used to compare the modeling approaches in accurately and efficiently determining the chemical composition of pulp wood using NIR spectroscopy were partial least squares (PLS) regression, least square support vector machine (LSSVM), back-propagation neural network (BPNN), and kernel extreme learning machine (KELM).

instruction: Can the combination of multiplicative scatter correction and the KELM method with an inexpensive and portable NIR spectrometer be used to accurately and efficiently determine the chemical composition of pulp wood, in order to improve production efficiency in the pulp and paper industry?
Output: Yes. The combination of multiplicative scatter correction and the KELM method with an inexpensive and portable NIR spectrometer can be used to accurately and efficiently determine the chemical composition of pulp wood. This combination was found to effectively eliminate spectral noise and irrelevant information, and the KELM method displayed the best prediction performance compared to other modeling approaches. Therefore, this approach can be used to improve production efficiency in the pulp and paper industry by providing real-time measurement of holocellulose and lignin contents in pulp wood.
